page.title: 03HOARWITHY VILLAGE
page.content: Hoarwithy is a pretty rural riverside village with cottages and houses built into the bank overlooking the River Wye.The Italian style Church built in the 1880s provides an unusualfeature,where the congregation attend a monthly service.The Wye is crossed here by a Victorian iron bridge with its former angular toll house standing alongside.There has been little recent development,but older properties have been extended and improved.Small farms surround the village which has become popular for holiday cottages and retirement homes.With decline in population and easier mobility many services and activities have gone,but there is a builder,an inn,guest house,farm offering B/B,a post office and flower club.A DR. surgery is held twice weekly,and the m/library calls monthly
